intro: Grammitis gradata, commonly known as the graduated moss, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, intricate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually closely spaced and have a distinctive gradient in coloration from the base to the tip. Grammitis gradata plays a role in forest ecosystems by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms.
